meanings.definition: Not emphasized or stressed in pronunciation.
meanings.sent1: The unaccented syllables in the word 'banana' are not pronounced loudly.
meanings.sent2: She spoke in an unaccented tone, blending in with the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The unaccented words in the play were easily forgotten by the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her unaccented performance on stage left the audience wanting more.
meanings.sent5: The unaccented notes in the music added a sense of calm to the piece.

meanings.definition: Lacking a distinctive or prominent accent.
meanings.sent1: His unaccented speech made it difficult to determine where he was from.
meanings.sent2: The newscaster had an unaccented voice that was easy to understand.
meanings.sent3: The unaccented dialect of the character made him seem like a man of mystery.
meanings.sent4: Her unaccented style of dress made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The unaccented flavor of the dish left much to be desired.

meanings.definition: Not marked with a diacritic or accent mark.
meanings.sent1: The unaccented letters in the text were easy to read.
meanings.sent2: In English, most letters are unaccented and do not have marks above them.
meanings.sent3: The unaccented vowels in the word 'resume' can be confusing for some.
meanings.sent4: Her unaccented handwriting was neat and easy to read.
meanings.sent5: The unaccented characters in the font made the text look clean and modern.
